title: Amazon’s big spring sale continues, and we found the 100 best deals
snippets: Amazon has launched its Big Spring Sale, which runs until March 31, 2025. The event features discounts on gardening supplies, bedding, and more, coinciding with the start of the warmer months.
summary: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is underway until March 31, 2025, offering discounts on various items including gardening supplies and bedding. The sale is timed to coincide with the beginning of the warmer season.

title: Assassin’s Creed Shadows lives up to the series’ name
snippets: Assassin's Creed Shadows introduces advanced stealth and assassination mechanics, offering a challenging yet rewarding experience for players. This iteration is noted for its precision in gameplay, marking a significant achievement in the franchise's development of stealth elements.
summary: Assassin's Creed Shadows enhances the franchise with advanced stealth and assassination mechanics, providing a more challenging and rewarding gameplay experience. It is recognized for its precise gameplay, signifying a notable advancement in the series' stealth aspects.

title: I’m still testing the new Razer Blade 16 and I have mixed feelings
snippets: The Razer Blade 16 is a gaming laptop that aims to be an alternative to the MacBook Pro, featuring a design that balances gaming capabilities with a thin and light chassis. This marks a return to a more streamlined design after previous models increased in size.
summary: The Razer Blade 16 gaming laptop is designed as a MacBook Pro alternative, offering a balance between gaming performance and a slim, lightweight body. This represents a shift back to a more streamlined design following earlier models that had grown larger.

title: BougeRV’s telescopic lantern is ridiculously versatile
snippets: BougeRV's LED lantern, marketed as an outdoor camplight, functions as a versatile work lamp suitable for various lighting needs. It features a rechargeable, compact design with three swiveling LED panels that emit 3000 lumens, ideal for illuminating campsites, workspaces, or engine blocks.
summary: BougeRV has released an LED lantern designed for outdoor camping, which doubles as a work lamp. It offers a rechargeable, compact design with three adjustable LED panels that produce 3000 lumens, making it suitable for lighting up campsites, workspaces, or engine blocks.

title: Judge saves the CFPB, for now
snippets: On Friday, a court, led by Judge Amy Berman Jackson, issued a preliminary injunction to prevent the Trump administration and its Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) during ongoing legal proceedings.
summary: On Friday, Judge Amy Berman Jackson issued a preliminary injunction to stop the Trump administration and its Department of Government Efficiency from dismantling the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) while legal proceedings are ongoing.

title: Windows 11 is closing a loophole that let you skip making a Microsoft account
snippets: Microsoft has updated its Windows 11 Insider Preview, removing a bypass script that previously allowed users to set up the operating system without an internet connection and logging in. This change enforces the requirement for all Windows 11 devices to be connected to the internet and logged in during setup.
summary: Microsoft updated its Windows 11 Insider Preview, eliminating a script that let users install the OS without an internet connection and without logging in. Now, setting up Windows 11 requires internet access and user login.

title: The 30 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals under $30
snippets: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is currently underway and will run until Monday, March 31st. The sale features dozens of deals accessible without an Amazon Prime membership. A comprehensive roundup includes over 100 deals on popular gear, alongside a selection of low-cost alternatives.
summary: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is ongoing until March 31st, offering numerous deals that do not require an Amazon Prime membership. The sale includes a wide range of popular items and budget-friendly alternatives, with a total of over 100 deals featured.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI buys Elon Musk’s X for $33 billion on paper
snippets: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has acquired the social media platform X, previously known as Twitter, in an all-stock deal. Musk valued xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, which includes $12 billion in debt. This acquisition comes a few years after Musk originally purchased Twitter for $44 billion.
summary: Elon Musk's AI firm, xAI, has bought the social media site X (formerly Twitter) in an all-stock transaction. Musk valued xAI at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, including $12 billion of debt. This follows Musk's initial acquisition of Twitter for $44 billion a few years earlier.

title: Microsoft tests Quick Machine Recovery to restore PCs that can’t boot
snippets: Microsoft has begun testing Quick Machine Recovery in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653), a feature aimed at enabling IT professionals to remotely recover Windows 11 devices that won't boot. This development comes as a response to prevent incidents similar to the previous year's Crowdstrike catastrophe.
summary: Microsoft is trialing a new feature called Quick Machine Recovery in the latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) for Windows 11. This tool is designed to help IT professionals remotely fix devices that fail to boot, aiming to avert issues like those experienced during last year's Crowdstrike event.

title: The Fitbit-to-Google account migration deadline moves to 2026
snippets: Google has extended the deadline for Fitbit users to migrate their accounts to Google accounts until next year, following its acquisition of Fitbit in early 2021. Initially, users were required to make this transition by 2025, but a recent email to Fitbit users announced the extension.
summary: Google has postponed the deadline for Fitbit users to switch their accounts to Google accounts to next year, after initially setting a 2025 deadline. This change follows Google's acquisition of Fitbit in early 2021, as communicated in a recent email to Fitbit users.

title: Researchers identify mutations that can lead to resistance to some chemotherapies
snippets: Investigators have discovered that mutations to VPS35, a crucial component in a pathway using reactive oxygen species (ROS) to eliminate cancer cells, can lead to resistance against chemotherapies. This finding could aid in identifying tumors that are resistant to treatments.
summary: Investigators found that mutations in VPS35, essential for a pathway that uses reactive oxygen species (ROS) to destroy cancer cells, can cause resistance to chemotherapy. This discovery may help identify tumors resistant to treatment.

title: Discrimination-related depression, anxiety pronounced among multiracial, White, Asian populations
snippets: A study reveals that over 50% of US adults have faced discrimination, significantly impacting mental health. Those highly exposed to discrimination are over five times more likely to show signs of depression and anxiety. Compared to those unaffected, individuals experiencing discrimination have nearly nine times the odds of screening positive for both mental health conditions.
summary: A study shows that over half of US adults have experienced discrimination, which greatly affects their mental health. Those facing high levels of discrimination are more than five times likely to exhibit depression and anxiety symptoms. Compared to unaffected individuals, those experiencing discrimination have almost nine times higher chances of showing signs of both mental health issues.

title: Meniscus injuries may soon be treated by customizable hydrogel
snippets: A new customizable hydrogel, created using 3D printing technology, has shown promising results in preclinical trials for treating various types of meniscal tears.
summary: A new hydrogel developed with 3D printing technology has shown potential in preclinical trials for treating different kinds of meniscal tears. This customizable hydrogel could offer new options for patients with these knee injuries.

title: Cold plunges actually change your cells
snippets: Cold water immersion for a week has been shown to boost cellular resilience and autophagic function, which helps cells better cope with stress. This adaptation may improve health, increase longevity, and help prevent diseases by slowing down cellular aging.
summary: A week of cold water immersion has been found to enhance cellular resilience and autophagic function, aiding cells in stress management. This adaptation could potentially enhance health, extend lifespan, and aid in disease prevention by decelerating cellular aging.

title: Researchers develop new DNA test for personalized treatment of bacterial vaginosis
snippets: Approximately one-third of women aged 14-49 in the U.S. experience bacterial vaginosis (BV), marked by odors and discomfort, with potential long-term health risks. Over half of those treated with the first-line antibiotic, metronidazole, face recurrence. Researchers have now created a DNA PCR-based lab test aimed at improving treatment by analyzing the bacteria responsible for BV, allowing for more personalized medication prescriptions.
summary: About one-third of U.S. women aged 14-49 suffer from bacterial vaginosis, which can cause odors and discomfort. Over 50% see a recurrence after initial treatment with metronidazole. Researchers have developed a DNA PCR-based lab test to better target the bacteria causing BV, enabling more tailored treatments.

title: Why scientists are worried about weasels
snippets: Researchers have discovered that red meat, enhanced with scent oils, is the most effective bait for capturing weasel images on camera traps. This finding aids conservationists in tracking weasel populations, as these animals are notoriously hard to photograph.
summary: Researchers have found that using red meat laced with scent oils is the best bait for photographing weasels with camera traps. This technique helps conservationists in monitoring weasel populations, which are difficult to capture on camera.

title: Artificial neurons organize themselves
snippets: Researchers have developed novel artificial neurons that mimic biological ones more closely, capable of independent learning. These infomorphic neurons form artificial neural networks that self-organize and adapt by extracting information from their surroundings.
summary: Researchers have created advanced artificial neurons that closely resemble biological ones, with the ability to learn on their own. These neurons form networks that can self-organize and adapt to their environment by processing information around them.

title: Brain channels 'stopped in time' reveal chemical flow that enables learning and thinking

summary: A recent study has found ways to potentially create drugs that can block or open signaling channels, offering new treatment possibilities for epilepsy and some intellectual disorders.
